data.message:
#4168: I've been here for a couple of years now and I'm graduating this term. All I want to do is find a lady who is adventurous who isn't looking for something serious. Lets hang and chat about all the fun, wonderful things that we've done with our lives. I don't want to hear about "where this is going?" Guess what? I don't know where it's going. I just don't know.

Let it go. Just enjoy the time together. Just simply enjoy it. There are NO guarantees in life. Deal with it. Why not just have fun and see where it goes. We're in college where we should just simply go out, have a life and enjoy it. Are there any girls out there who could simply do that?

Couldn't be wronger! A relationship gives you two things no random hookups do: 1- the capacity to have any and all sorts of sex. All you have to do is communicate about it with your partner (which isn't always easy, but the way is to think of sexual roles as part of game where you play at being someone or something). 2- Better sex, because like with everything, practice makes perfect.
You are extremely wrong.
completely wrong; i can first handedly account for that! best, craziest, roughest sex ive ever had is with my boyfriend. :)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=768h3Tz4Qik
Safe, sane, consensual; As long as it follows those three, sex can't be wrong.
You are wrong.

100% wrong honey there are no rules to sex other than be safe and don't rape lol the type of sex you have is based on what you feel at that moment: sometimes I want my back kissed sometimes i want my ass slapped and sometimes I just want to be the boss lol ... don't let it get monotonous dear
Trust me, you're totally wrong.

Rough sex can keep a relationship interesting lol
Thats a good thing!

#4167: I feel like it's wrong to want crazy rough sex in a relationship. For some reason, it feels like a hookup can be a lot steamier while doing it with the boyfriend has to be tamer. Someone please confirm that I'm wrong on this.

#4166: A lot of people complain about posts being sad or negative. I don't really care, just make it interesting. If you're gonna be depressing at least make me say 'oh shiiit' or 'that blows'
That's what we're all here for anyways.
Wow. You deserve better than that.
I concur

#4165: i recently had a falling out with a friend-with-benefits, because she wanted me to talk with her about my feelings. so i decided to open up to her, and i got the world famous "k" in response to everything i said. why is that acceptable to women? it's basically as useless and just not replying. it's, in fact worse. thanks for being unable to take a minute to formulate something comforting or something to show that you understand or relate or feel the same way or don't or aren't a total sloot.
as long as youre not forcing your partner to join you, i see no problem with being a vegan. if they truly care, they'll accept it and continue on same as before
If you think that guys care about a girl's diet than you're just as clueless as we are about the opposite sex.
Do you, if anyone doesn't accept that, they're not worth it.

being a vegan is tough when you go out to dinner on dates unless you go to special restaurants. if you're cooking at home it's no big deal. you can make a vegan meal as a base and then supplement with meat or anything else your future boyfriend would like. the right guy will respect your beliefs and dietary restrictions.

#4164: I'm a vegetarian thinking about becoming a vegan but I'm worried that if I become vegan I will be too high-maintanance to ever attract a boyfriend. I don't want my diet to be an inconvenience for the people in my life, but I also don't want to compromise my morals (on what I see as a life or death issue for these animals) to avoid making other people uncomfortable.

Maybe you're being too nice? They probably only cheat because they think they can get away with it, so show them that they can't and give zeros. Don't give extensions unless they've earned it. Idk. I've tutored a lot, and it's the few with a real desire to learn that makes the job satisfying.
Yes.
They seem to have the money to go here, make them pay you $100 for an A+. Easy money.
If they want to throw their money and time at a piece of paper, I say let them. They won't learn if they don't want to anyways, focus on the ones who do want to learn.

#4163: This is my 3rd year working as a TA... The first year I really liked it and tried to get to know all of my students.  The second year, not so much.  Now, I dislike the overwhelming majority of my students.  They cheat. They lie. They are rude.  They ask for extensions but only a few of them ever come in for help.  I try hard to make my classes run smoothly, and I always come to class prepared.  Is it too much to ask students to do the same?
find the thirsty ones. they'll sort you straight.

There are probably a lot more available girls than you think. But I'm sure we would all agree that dinner is a good segue into sex. :P It doesn't even need to be anything fancy; it just makes sex a bit more... enjoyable I suppose?
Have you been reading this page at all?!

Nothing is wrong with what you're saying, I'm sure plenty of people would be down for it. I just feel bad for you to be honest because you need to essentially pencil in sex onto your schedule because you lack time for intimacy. If you find the right person, you won't need to impress her with money or find time in your day to go see her. You'll just be intimate because it'll feel right, regardless on how busy you are. So good luck on your search, I just hope you make the time to open up to someone one day.

#4162: How down are girls here for 'fuck buddies?' I don't want a relationship or to go dating or spend unnecessary money trying to impress a girl. I have so much school work and responsibilities on my plate that I don't have the time for that kind of commitment. I just want to release my sexual tension and fuck passionately on a semi-regular basis. I know romance has its place and I believe love finds itself down the road, but what is so wrong with a mutually non-exclusive sexual arrangement?
are you stupid
That you should definitely, whatever you do, not say something to him.
That you should talk to him.
add his ass
#4161: so....i uh wrote a post describing a guy that i like and a situation we sorta have...and the guy liked it. what's that supposta mean?!?!?
and then there are people looking for more than a vagina/dick in a girl/boy. people act differently once you become intimate with them, and people are shit at realizing it.

#4160: to girls, stop worrying about what your bitchy friends think of that nice (but not so popular) guy that you like and give him a shot. to guys, stop nailing the only sweet and cute girls we have left and breaking their hearts. just choose one. vaginas all feel the same. they may vary slightly in quality and taste but youre not going to find a girl with a magic vagina that blows all others out of the water. and telling the story of how you deceived a woman into sleeping with you doesn't make you cool it just makes the guys who hear it want to bang your mother/sister in front of you

#4017: I don't know how some people can wait to get married before having sex with their partner. What if you're not compatible sexually? You people realize that that's actually a thing that can happen, right? None of that, 'Oh certain positions' or 'We'll make it work.' Just no. Your man's penis can be too small or too big for you, and your vagina too loose or tight for him, whatever. Like seriously, what if you're just not a good match in bed? How can you just get married like that? Plus, sex the first time with someone can be really awk. None of that, 'But we love each other.' You're both idiots and need to be sexually educated. And this one yeah, goes out to you. I think you and your fiance are dumb.

Honestly, it depends on the people. And you should respect other people's decisions in their relationships, whether they choose to do it when they do for religious reasons, spontaneous reasons, or for precautionary measures (i.e. Avoiding getting pregnant).  People need to stop judging others on their sex lives (conversely, people should probably not broadcast their sex lives OR lack thereof); it's called a "private life" for a reason.

#4159: To secret #4017
Yes, having sex for the first time can be awkward. But having sex with someone you love is incredibly special. Sex isn't wholly about pleasure. It's about becoming one with the person you share your most vulnerable moments with. People who choose to wait till marriage have a bond others don't in that their hearts will only have ever been given to each other. It's an ultimate form of trust. The couple you're referring to isn't stupid and doesn't "need to be sexually educated". What they need is to enjoy their relationship in whatever way makes them happy without your judgement.
it shows that they are proud of their sexuality and are finally comfortable enough to express it to everyone. it is a huge step for some people and if you can't handle it, just unfriend them.
There is no need to make the whole social media world uncomfortable, please keep your homophobia to yourself
Because sexual identity does matter, otherwise you wouldn't be so strongly opposed to your cousin coming out on Facebook. You're only being a self-righteous moron by asking that.
This is such buffoonery 😂
it's a big deal for certain people, and it isn't for others. if they feel they need to get it out over fb, let them. if it makes you uncomfortable, then don't read it. it's facebook. keep scrolling.
wow lol are you sure this secret didn't get here from "ole miss secrets" this sounds like an 80 year old wrote it
OBAMA LOVING LIBERAL ERA! Michael Partelow
Obama sucks.
hatin on your cousin. that's cold.
There's a reason the gay male African-American community of Chicago refers to Obama as Bathhouse Barry, ya know . . . and let's not forget the testimony of Larry Sinclair
Congratulations you just did worse identifying coming out with liking Obama.. If you're actually pissed take the Reagan bust out of your ass and post this as your status you hypocrite
wow this comment pisses me off so much

Because we live in an era where it is "edgy" to announce to the world that, if you're a guy, you like to take it up the ass, or if you are a girl, that you like to scissors and eat cunt. Maybe your faggot cousin will get a congratulatory letter or phone call from President Obama for his or her "courageousness" LOLOLOL!!!!!

#4158: My cousin recently came out on Facebook. Why do people think facebook is a place to post such things. If you come out there is no need to make others feel uncomfortable by telling the whole social media world. If your sexual identity doesn't matter in this new progressive obama loving liberal era we are living in then why announce it?
Unless they're all being posted by one very lonely person.

#4157: All these "I don't like to party or drink I just wanna chill omg no one understands me I need friends" posts are getting annoying as fuck. Theres so many that its become pretty obvious you're not alone and have lots of friends to choose from. Stop whining about it and go out and look for them, don't expect an anonymous post to solve your problems.

data.message: Welcome to Miami.
The thirst is real
Why are you on NYUs secrets page?
well if you're talking about nyu, i've heard that the gender ratio there is like 60% girls and a lot of the guys are gay, so that probably affects thiings
sex, food and fear are the greatest drives in the animal kingdom...
because Miami girls are sensual :3
Because sex is generally awesome.
Cause all we do is fuck and party
Miami is sex city aside from LA
#4156: Why is UMiami Secrets so much more sexual than other "secrets" pages (like NYU Secrets)? Like every other post is about something erotic...

#4155: I'm sorry if I've been a pain lately, but it would've been nice to see you. I've had the utmost respect for you, always. I may have been cold these few months, but imagine how you would feel if you loved someone who made you feel like a waste of space. Would you not eventually build a wall to ensure you don't get hurt? I hope no one ever trivializes you. I genuinely thought you'd want to spend even a few minutes with me; I didn't think I was asking for much, but I suppose parties are more precious than someone who cherishes you. I've bent over backwards for you numerous times, and I did NOT expect you to do the same for me, but I never fathomed that you would still be ashamed of me. After more than a year, I still love you, and it kills me. It hurt badly at first, but I've gotten over it. My only request is that you never treat -anyone- the way you've treated me (please); I don't care how ugly or worthless you think she is: no one deserves to feel like an ignominious waste of space.
Samantha Goodwin
This actually made my day. Athletes like that are the reason we do what we do.
Jonathan White lemme get a massage dog
Taylor Amelia
Julia Giampaolo Rachel Gregory 😘😘 ayyyye love you guys.
Maxwell Sagessa
Sam Jazzo Lindsay Lee Malik Bibby Daniel Scribner Kyle Hernden Stephanie Shay
Pause
This made me smile. I needed that. I love what we learn and what we do.
Eryn Croft 😊😁
Hannah Kendrick

#4154: Honestly, if it weren't for the athletic trainers and their students, I probably wouldn't be a student athlete anymore. Actually, I would probably not have any future athletic career at all. My respects go out to you guys, some of us athletes notice how you all work your asses off everyday, and get little notice. Y'all got the schedule of a student athlete x 3 plus a normal schedule. Basically, thank you guys for keeping me alive. And no, they are not personal trainers lol, but they give bomb ass massages tho
WC is open till 10pm on the weekends, just so everyone knows
Plus it's one of the biggest sources of corporate welfare for the university. :)

#4153: Why does everybody always disrespect the gym employees? Many of them work their asses off. The Wellness Center is one of the largest student employers on campus, and is basically all student run at night, on the weekends, and during many breaks. Plus, they are open more than many other places on campus, 6am-12am M-TH, 6am-11am F, 8am - sometime on weekends. What if they all just decided to strike, how many of you would appreciate them only when there is no gym to go to. Or when you get hurt playing basketball or in the gym and there is no - one to respond. Everyone works for different reasons, so give them your respect. You wouldn't want them going to your job and acting the way I see some of you act at the gym. This actually goes for anywhere on campus, the Rat, the UC, etc...we are all students. Be nice. Also, shout out to the people who take care of injuries.
It was designed to trap ghosts.
Cox is also bad
Its the oldest building at the University so the handicap additions are the best they could do considering how it is designed.
I hate the Merrick building and all my classes are there.
Have always disliked merrick because of its design
It's poorly designed and yeah being so old they didn't think of how people would be handicapped back then and etc.
SO true!

Merrick was first built before 1920. It was one of the first buildings on campus and it's been added onto since it was originally made. The building wasn't finished because a boat sank at sea with most of the building materials.. Ever notice the strange spire coming out of the top of it?

#4152: Okay, don't get me wrong, this campus is beautiful. It is in a beautiful city. But - what the hell is up with the design of some of these buildings. I would like too specifically highlight as an example, the Merrick Building, it's almost like the designer of this building was like, well gee f*ck the handicapped. Why the hell do I have to walk up 4 flights of stairs, down 2, then up 3 just to get to one classroom. No. Just f*cking no. That makes no sense. The designer if that building belongs in an asylum.
#4151: Since high school I've always worn a jockstrap to workout/play sports and I don't see how other guys don't wear them to work out. They keep the entire package together and comfortable.
Too bad im graduating. But this is a great idea!

#4150: I am currently in the process of forming a new club next year called the Transfer Student Association and I am in need of people (preferably those who have also transferred to UM) to join the e-board. I am really struggling to find people who are willing to put in the time to help me build this club from the ground up and would really appreciate anyone willing to help! Positions that need to be filled are Treasurer, Academic Event Coordinator, and Social-Life Event Coordinator. Please email me at a.buchanan@umiami.edu. Thanks!
The counseling center definitely helps, but you can typically only get an appointment 2-3 weeks prior unless there is an emergency.
Craig's right, but sometimes there are cancellations and in that case, they can squeeze you in sooner.
They're great, definitely go, it will be worthwhile.
They will be there to help you with that and SO much more!
Yeah, they're good.
It's good for talking out your problems and figuring out what's healthy or unhealthy in your life

#4149: Has anyone gone to the Counseling Center? Is it easy to get an appointment, and are they good? 

I've been going through a lot of drama with my family and my boyfriend. My friends are really supportive but I still hold back from them because I don't want them to worry about me, and I don't want them to judge me. I also feel like I should be able to solve my own problems. 

I'm starting to think maybe I should talk to someone for real. Does anyone have advice about the Counseling Center? Is this something they'll be able to help with?

Just because you don't see a morphed image of yourself as fat when you look in the mirror doesn't mean you may not be having serious issues with your weight and body image right now. Your psychological reaction to simply eating a "normal sized meal" could be an indication as well. I am not a therapist but honestly, I do not think this healthy. If you realize that this might be a problem reach out to someone before it gets worse.

Eh, smoke some green. Cures all your symptoms. Makes you eat a shit ton and helps make you feel less guilty and depressed. 
Or go see a shrink. Idfk. 
Food for thought.

Everyone's experience is different, please don't let your ideas about what an eating disorder is "supposed" to be like keep you from reaching out to a professional. The bottom line is it sounds like this is starting to interfere with the quality of your daily life and you deserve better.

Just because you dont have body dismorphia doesnt mean you dont have an eating disorder. Clearly, you KNOW what youre doing is unhealthy since youre trying to convince others (but actually just yourself)
Dude this has eating disorder written all over it, especially if you took the time to write this post, you must be somewhat concerned. Shit gets ugly fast, get help before it spirals out of control.
Eating disorders involve way more than thinking you're fat. You should call the counseling center.

The idea of seeing that "fat" version of yourself in the mirror doesn't necessarily mean you see a literal morphed version of yourself or all you can see on yourself is fat. Anorexia is as much a harmful state of mind as a detrimental physical condition. If you're dealing with issues with body image and health concerns that are disproportionate to your actual physical state, it's a good idea for you to talk to someone at the counseling center or your doctor.

#4148: Over this past year I have slowly become obsessed with losing weight.  I was never overweight to begin with, weighing 123 pounds when I came here in the fall.  However, I now only weigh 100 pounds and my BMI is now considered underweight.  The reason I don't believe I have anorexia is because when I look in the mirror I don't see a morphed image of myself as a fat person.  I know that I am a rack of bones as my boobs and ass have shrunk and none of my old jeans or shorts fit.  However, whenever I eat a normal sized meal or snack I feel incredibly guilty and depressed, so I continue to eat very little per day.  My friends and family have noticed my weightloss but I usually put up pics of food such as pizza, cake, etc. on my Instagram so they won't be concerned.  However in reality I stole these food pics off tumblr and I never actually ate them.

And also if your boyfriend doesn't want to please you, then there's something wrong with your relationship. Sex should be enjoyed mutually.

I honestly only ever really have sex if my partner wants to because I know that if I don't keep my man happy in bed, someone else will. I also know that if my boyfriend knew I didn't enjoy sex he would initiate it less and then our relationship would die. #4091: I really can't stand my roommate. I know it's probably my fault I'm with him in the first place because I opted to go random instead of filling out the profile but this shit sucks. It's not because he doesn't go out or anything, that's cool do your thing, but he is literally the single most bland person I've ever met. It's like living with a sack of potatoes if said sack went to sleep at 10:30 every night and made weird ass noises in his sleep. So happy to be rooming with one of my friends next semester. Good riddance.
Ooooooooh killem!!!!
Shots fired.

#4142: 4091, If this is who I think it is, then believe me the feeling is completely mutual. It's funny that you can go as far as calling me a sack of potatoes and bland when you've never even attempted a conversation with me and shot down my every attempt at being nice and social with you last semester. If you had an issue with me you could have moved out or better yet confronted me like a man instead of posting on this page like a coward. If anything, the sack of potatoes is you. And yes, I do like to sleep early if I ever get the chance, I have difficult early classes and don't have the luxury of sleeping in until 2 in the afternoon like a slob. You'd know more about that than I though. As for your friend, I wish him all the luck dealing with your  arrogance and vile demeanor. Good riddance. By the way, it's about time you actually do laundry for once, the smell emitting from your clothes is appalling and febreze isn't helping.
#allbymyself

#4141: Has anyone noticed that a lot of these secrets are about wanting companionship, frustrations with someone else being inconsiderate, or struggling with low self esteem? It seems like everyone is looking for validation from their peers, either romantically, socially, or just as a decent human being. 

We're all going through a really chaotic stage of life, trying to figure out who we are and what we want. Please try to remember this before you hate on someone. We all deserve to find our own happiness in our own way, and at some point everyone needs a helping hand. 

Sending positive vibes to all those who need a little bit of love in their lives. <3

#4140: After all of the posts bitching about the roommate from Hell and being able to fully relate, I'm going to start a series of helpful tips on how to before than a piece of shit, clueless cohabitant. These rules stretch beyond the boundaries of the dorm room and should help you whenever you decide to get your own place. 

Room mate tip #1: the dishwasher. It isn't magic. Rinse your dishes before putting them in. It'll maintain the look of the dish.

In my opinion, the change is astronomical. But, remember one thing: we attract what we project. Freshman year I realized that even tho I was very annoyed by other people, I had a lot of immature traits myself. I became dedicated to changing myself and it made all the difference. I am now ready to graduate in may and I cannot have asked for a better University of Miami experience!

People care more their freshman year because everyone knows everyone and is "watching" to see what everyone else does (for a lack of better words). Once you get out of freshman year and move no one around you will care what you're doing and it'll feel less suffocating.

You just need to find people who are interested in the same things that you are. There are plenty of career oriented people out there and to be honest I met most of my friends in class, not in the dorms... But try to loosen up a bit as well, it is good to keep a balance and to find a group  who will do both, study and relax. Find people who work as hard as you but who also know how to have fun.
Well you can't just move after freshmen year, your the kind of person who just needs someone to love, and at the end of the day anyone has the potential to love you if you just love them back.

The same thing happened to me. One day I looked around and could not stop thinking about how high-school these people were acting. I tried to make friends and to give the benefit of the doubt but I had enough. Take my advice: Wake up. Get up. Walk away. Don't look back. 
If you're not happy where you are, change it. I did. It took me a while to find friends that I felt comfortable around and was happy that in the back of my mind I wasn't thinking bad things. But just stop hanging out with those people. One day in a class you enjoy you'll sit next to someone that has the same interests and you'll become friends. Don't sweat it.
Meanwhile, I come from a place called Niceville and have met more accepting, genuine people here than I have there

People will get more mature, but their nature will never change.  There are some genuine people around here but significantly less than where I come from.  Just remember that not every college is for everyone and there's no harm in applying to other schools.

You should surround yourself with different people! When I was a freshman I didn't hang out with people like that because that's not what I was into. It's perfectly fine for some people to be interested in those things, but it's just not what I wanted to do with my time so I went and found people who were more similar to me and hung out with them. That's what's nice about college - there are all types.
It changes

It doesn't get better, but you meet more people who are more like you. You join clubs, and go to classes with people who have the same interests as you. You start to really be able to pick who you associate with.
But, on occasion, you'll still have to associate with those superficial people. Stay strong, my friend! :P

Meh, people don't really change in my opinion but that's the age, not the school. But trust me, there are plenty of awesome people who aren't all about one night stands and clubs - you just have to find them

#4139: To all the sophomores, juniors, and seniors out there, I'm just wondering if people legitimately get better after freshman year. I mean I have asked multiple friends who don't go to miami about this but I want someone from this school'a perspective on this. If you couldn't tell, I am a freshman who is just really tired of how immature people around me are. They care about the most superficial things, like hooking up with boys, partying, and drinking til they can't even remember anything that happened. Meanwhile I'm here really trying to do something with my life and I guess getting ahead of the game. However, I really would like someone to share my awesome college experiences with and just joke around without thinking about what I even have to say to them. It's just hard and I'm almost considering transferring unless I feel like there's hope.
Nope

Ok, so 2 questions, but keep in mind this is only me. YMMV
1) Nope. Not in the least. Ignoring the option of taking your hyperbole literally, I still tend to find that "type" to be meh at best, if only going by appearance, and adding in other things tends to reduce my opinion of them. 
B) Well, ignoring the fact that I'm too much of a coward to go to parties/flirt with ladies, maybe the same reasons you aren't hinting that you aren't like the other party girls and make a move? If you want someone to "make a move on you", why don't you drop the gambling and go make a move on them?

#4138: Do the guys on campus only dig blonde girls, who are stick skinny, always showing off their butt cheeks, who wear an excessive amount of makeup and like to act vulnerable to get a guys attention? Also if you're flirting with a girl repeatedly and she flirts back... why don't you hint you're not like the other party boys and make a move?
I am so sorry you have to give her up... I wish I could take her in. :( Good luck finding her a loving home!
No problem :) Ashley Robins
We can't see it :(
I wish I could take her, but I'm living in a dorm next year. Good luck with finding her a good home!
And here's another pic
Oh you can't see it? Sorry, Facebook is stupid.
Sarah Poliquin love you <3

#4137: My life is being turned upside-down and I need help. I'm being forced to chose between a close friend and my pet. My roommate for next year is severely allergic to cats, and I happen to currently have a beautiful tabby cat, around 8 months old. She has all her shots and comes with a litter box, cuddles, and moments so adorable, the iciest heart will melt. If you are interested in providing a loving home to this fantastic feline, please email me at s.poliquin@umiami.edu
Pictures of Dr. Rosalind Victor Becquerel Nikola Van Helsing Schrodinger, aka Rose:
https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=611978972217839&l=cc53387ca0
https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=611978992217837&l=4de42f8371

Well, if you can't trust your friends, maybe they shouldn't be counted among your friends, but that's a whole sepperate problem. I would suggest you, and anyone in a similar situation, just tell her. Maybe your wrong and she does feel the same way about you. Maybe she doesn't and is alright with it, and it evolved into something else, an even better friendship. Or maybe she doesn't but it makes things awkward between you two. But even that ending is better than letting your imagination come up with what will "inevitably happen".
Every guy ever has been there. Break out of the friend zone. Maybe it works,  maybe it doesnt. Still, getting it off of your chest is the best thing you can do. good luck!

#4136: I'm in love with my best female friend. But if I tell her i don't think she will ever believe me. On top of that I know that she has no interest in me. I try to hide this secret but i think its slowly becoming apparent to all my friends and it scares the living shit out of me. It scares me because I don't trust any of my friends.

I've been at the lab a while and made mistakes like that, it's not easy I know. What you have to understand is that your mentor is also a student whose career and degree ride on completing their project on time. It can be stressful but they are human too. If you have so much trouble go to the lab director, or whoever is above your mentor (hopefully it's a big enough lab for that) and tell them what happened and that you would still like to stay and learn with a mentor (grad student) who would be more amenable to teaching you because you truly love research. I say all this assuming that your mentor is indeed a grad student and not one of the actual lab staff ( manager, director etc) if it is staff then nvm you're fucked kid, just bail and reapply elsewhere.
eh at this point, cut your losses. just leave and go to another lab and don't make the same mistakes as last time.

everyone is focused on a future. but in college, there's so much focus on the basis of your future being having a good job. that's not it. you find some guy who's kooky and fun and loving, and you make him yours, and get an apartment or flat or whatever and a job, and work your way up through a workplace. people don't need to be CEO's right out of college. people are supposed to be happy and experienced out of college. if you're not happy, you failed the college experience.

#4081: As much as I love focusing on my future career and school, I desperately want someone to call mine. To be called someone's girl. "School first, life second" has been my mantra for the past years, and although I couldn't be happier with how my work is paying off and the opportunities that I have been presented with, none of that can fill the place that a boyfriend could. Someone to come home to at the end of a long day. Take naps with. Escape from the busy, nonstop world outside to the simple comfort of not being alone.

I think I found someone who could be that, but I've been shut off from those emotions for so long I don't know how to read him. I seem like I have it all together and like my life the way it is, but truthfully it would be so much happier if we gave it a shot. I just wish I knew if that's a possibility, before I like you too much.
This was already posted yesterday.

I feel a little uncomfortable with the idea of "trying every race" like they are ice cream flavors or something. Date people for who they are, not the color of their skin. Yes, step outside of your comfort zone. Yes, branch out. But I don't think you are going to find what you are looking for just by checking off that you've dated people from a couple different racial backgrounds.
Did you just say there's only four races??? I have stepped out of my comfort zone and it made me... uncomfortable lmao. .. but I talk to this Haitian guy... I'm not Haitian so it counts
Maybe he is thinking of white,black,asian,hispanic? Forgetting about all the other races?

#4080: We need more interracial relationships on this campus.  I'm so bored with 1) the very few amount of relationships I see and 2) the fact that people don't branch out.  

People are always whining about never finding the one.  Maybe you need to step out of your comfort zone.  People usually make their greatest discoveries outside of their comfort zones.

And don't say you've tried.  You can retreat back into your area of comfort when you've tried every race, and there's not that many.  There's only four, and chances are you've already tried your own.
#4079: I wish we could stop this friends with benefits horseshit and just date already. Cant you give me that respect?
Ambika Ray
#4078: It feels weird, but I sort of have a crush on my professor. The weird part is that he's so old (late 40s I'm guessing) and is married and all that. I've even met his wife before...
Whoaa
#4077: the only thing getting me through my study abroad experience without my boyfriend is PornHub and the end of my hairbrush

data.story: "#3983: To all those swole-bros..." on their own status.

data.message: #3983: To all those swole-bros at the gym. I admire your dedication to largeness. But sometimes it's important to pay attention to proportions. For example, workout your legs... I know you're proud of your huge arms and chest, but it's pretty sad to see you with a massive upper body and chicken legs, I mean can you even run properly with such disproportions? Another point of advice. If you're short and you workout your back along with the rest of your upper body so that it's width is equal to your height... You need to realize you have the dimensions of a square. So yeah. While you're worshipping your gods of largeness, just take a minute or so to pay attention to proportions. You're welcome. - Polykleitos.

#4076: I find it interesting that posts commenting on male appearances are perfectly ok (ex: #3983) but posts about female appearances get everyone up in arms (the one about the high-waisted shorts comes to mind). I realize that women are oppressed and objectified by men, so yes, there is something to get offended about, but do we choose a silly little secret to make war?
Arden Snell is my best friend. Message me
Arden Snell has a secret admirer!
Arden

#4075: To the girl with the short light brown dreads that always wears the tan leather high top sneakers. You are beautiful. I see you around all the time and think you are absolutely stunning. I am a girl and I have never been with or been attracted to girls, but you make me want to venture into new waters..... Are you into that? Can I help make you happy????
I feel like he might have been joking...
Why did you let this bother you so much...an offhand comment made you write 3 paragraphs...I think you need to reevaluate your life
You're just ranting cause he was black.
Lol. He probably was not being serious. Also, you should take an Africana Studies class.
Some valid points but then rants sheer ignorance........
Prolly a joke...I mean I laughed..
Racist = power + prejudice

Actually, in a lot of parts of America (including dear old Miami) people DO care that I'm black and they make a point of it by following me around in stores like I'm going to steal something, giving me terrible service, and backhanded comments.
you should've said yes and walked away
I don't know if I should good or bad about this post?
The way he said it makes it hard to believe he was joking or not.

#4074: The other day a black student's cane card fell at the dining hall and I was busy on my phone (yes, I know, how antisocial of me, whatever) so I didn't pick it up for him. He then proceeds to sigh and pick it up and say, "You didn't pick it up because I'm black, right?"... HOW DOES RACE HAVE ANYTHING TO DO WITH THAT!? The U.S. is the absolute most racist country I have ever been to and I've been to over 30 countries and lived in 6. Everything is about race and about differentiating one person from another. Ironically, it's not the white people that are racist here (as I would've imagined from the stereotype), it's actually black people. Just because your black and have been discriminated against in the past does not entitle you to use it as a reason for as to why people behave in a negative way towards you. No one CARES that you're black, it's just a skin color. You're a person, that's what people care about, so stop making everything about race, because so little of it is.

#4073: Truth is, I'm scared of being alone. When my life was at its worst, I always somehow had a boyfriend there to make it seem ok. I'm so scared that one day something awful will happen and I wont have anyone.

I've worn mine every day for 6 years. I've only taken it off for swim meets & baking so it doesn't get damaged. 
Now you've seen at least one.
Who cares if everyone else isn't wearing it? There's no need to feel ashamed of wearing it just because others choose not to #bealeadernotafollower
I just forget mine >.> if it's not in sight when I get up in the morning, then I don't think about it. But I'm too paranoid to lose it somewhere in my room that I put it in my jewelry box...
I wore mine for three years straight and I love it! It just clashes with my outfit sometimes and I forget haha

#4072: Is it just me or does no one wear there class ring? I got my ring because I am proud from the school I came from and I wear it with pride everyday and it bothers me that I rarely see anyone wear one. I don't know if people stop wearing class rings because they forget or because it is inconvenient or because they see it as childish wearing a high school ring. I just hope people start wearing them, so people can stop asking me why I'm wearing a class ring and making me feel like idiot for having one.
